definition: fourth of May, cf 五四運動|五四运动, national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
five/5
four/4
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
pinyin: wu3 si4 ai4 guo2 yun4 dong4

sentences.english: China has followed the West selectively since the May 4th Movement in 1919.
sentences.chinese: 自1919五四运动起，中国选择性地尾随西方。

sentences.english: The meeting also awarded some advanced units with the title of the May Fourth Red-banner Youth League and praised model young people.
sentences.chinese: 会议对市五四红旗团委等先进单位和个人进行了表彰。

sentences.english: Jerry: I remember that it began from the May fourth new culture movement.
sentences.chinese: 这个我记得，是从五四新文化运动开始的。

sentences.english: You can go to May 4 Square by No. 26 bus.
sentences.chinese: 你可以坐26路公交车去五四广场。

sentences.english: Sha Fei was a new woman who was influenced and awakened by May Fourth Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 莎菲是受“五四”革命影响而觉醒的新女性。

sentences.english: After the May 4th Movement it can be called the new traditional Chinese teaching.
sentences.chinese: “五四”运动之后，可称为新传统语文教学。

sentences.english: The Chinese Youth Day commemorates the May 4th Movement thar happened in 1919.
sentences.chinese: 中国青年节是纪念1919年发生的五四运动的日子。

sentences.english: Lu Yin's novels give off a strong smell of the times of May 4 Movement.
sentences.chinese: 庐隐的小说散发着“五四”时代的浓郁气息。

sentences.english: The May Fourth Movement against imperialism and feudalism broke out in Beijing in1919.
sentences.chinese: 反帝反封建的五四运动于一九一九年在北京爆发。

sentences.english: The colorful crystal ball weighs almost five thousand four hundred kilograms.
sentences.chinese: 五颜六色的水晶球重近五四零零公斤。

sentences.english: The May 4th Movement signifies a new period in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 五四运动标志着中国历史上一个新的时期。

sentences.english: The first chapter explores cognitive relationship between the ideology of May 4th Enlightenment and Shen Congwen as an intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 第一章，探究五四启蒙思潮与沈从文身份认知的关系。

sentences.english: Do you know the origin of Youth Day?
It was part of the world proletarian revolution of the time.
sentences.chinese: 五四运动是当时无产阶级世界革命的一部分。

sentences.english: The first part is about the formation of the background and conditions of Chen Duxiu's idea of newspaper and periodicals.
sentences.chinese: 五四前后陈独秀报刊编辑思想形成的背景和条件。

sentences.english: The Chinese people came into contact with Marxism-Leninism after the may Fouth movement.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民在五四运动后开始接触到马克思列宁主义。

definition: the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
anti-imperialist/anti-imperialists
abbr. for 五卅運動|五卅运动[wu3 sa4 yun4 dong4], The May Thirtieth Movement (1925)
to save from extinction/to save the nation
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
pinyin: wu3 si4 ai4 guo2 yun4 dong4

definition: student movement
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
Enlightenment (philosophy)
democracy
Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
Cultural Revolution (1966-1976)
anti-imperialist movement of 30th May 1925, involving general strike esp. in Shanghai, Guangzhou, Hong Kong etc
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
Marxism-Leninism
